Articles.Content:
I just took a long break from ksp, and I've came back, and I'm enjoying it - but I have a question about the communication dishes : 

I have a window to jool, but my tech isn't great (the longest ranged comms dish I have is the RA-15), and I don't know if that has enough range for jool + for future missions, does anybody have some rough estimates at where each dish can take you?

Edited October 24, 2016 by rocketbuilder
@rocketbuilder,you can get all your answers here:http://wiki.kerbalspaceprogram.com/wiki/CommNet
The very highest tech dish (the 100G rated one) will just barely get you to Jool. Otherwise, you have to plan on using "Limited Control Mode" or live Kerbals for your mission.

But the chart says that if I use the highest rated one with a fully upgraded tracking station I can get to Jool easily? Can I and which is better : Communotron 88-88 or RA-100?

Edited October 24, 2016 by rocketbuilder

The chart shows the range when your signal goes from 1% to 0%. So "easily" is not exactly the word I'd use. But yes, with a T3 Tracking Station you should get signal unless you are occluded.

The 88-88 is a lot lighter, a lot less drag, a lot cheaper -- but it can't relay.
